name: Hardest Canine Nutrition Trivia Quiz | Dogs | 10 Questions

questions.text: What type of nutrient is NOT necessary in a dog's diet?
questions.explanation:
Carbohydrate.

	Dogs do not require any carbohydrates (starches, sugars) in their diet. As carnivores, they can obtain their required nutrients from animal sources. However, most commercial foods are composed primarily of carbohydrates!

questions.text: What vitamin is not necessary in a dog's diet?
questions.explanation:
Vitamin C.

	Like other carnivores, dogs manufacture their own vitamin C.

questions.text: Feeding large quantities of garlic to your dog helps to repel fleas.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While small amounts of garlic will not harm a dog, large amounts can cause a temporary condition known as Heinz body anemia. There is no scientific proof that garlic repels fleas.

questions.text: Changing your dog's diet, for example from wet to dry food or vice versa, is best done over several days.
questions.explanation:
True.

	A phased change is recommended to avoid causing upset stomachs. Gradual phase in the new food by adding a small amount to the usual food on day one and increasing the proportions over the curse of a week until the dog is eating only the new food.

questions.text: Giving growing puppies calcium supplementation is a good idea.
questions.explanation:
False.

	A balanced food will have the correct amount of calcium. Oversupplementation can lead to skeletal problems.

questions.text: What is the most common dietary problem suffered by dogs in the US?
questions.explanation:
Obesity.

	Vets estimate that 40-60 percent of US dogs are overweight!

questions.text: High levels of dietary fat cause many health problems in non-overweight dogs.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Dogs can thrive on a diet of up to 60 percent fat if they are worked enough to burn off the calories! Dogs on low-fat diets can develop problems like dry skin.

questions.text: Why can feeding too much liver to a dog be dangerous?
questions.correct: It can cause Vitamin A poisoning
options: It contains too many stored toxins
questions.explanation:
It can cause Vitamin A poisoning.

	Despite popular rumors, the liver does not store toxins, but works to eliminate them from the body.

questions.text: Dogs can thrive on a diet of meat alone.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Meat contains little calcium and is lacking in other nutrients as well.

questions.text: An older, somewhat overweight female dog makes a midnight excursion into the garbage pail, eating all of the fat from the Christmas ham. Shortly afterwards, she begins to vomit and has severe diarrhea. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Pancreatitis.

	This is a classic presentation for pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). Dogs are very resistant to food poisoning.
